name: knish
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in Jewish cooking, a round or square piece of dough (= flour mixed with water and fat) that is filled with potato, meat, or other foods, and baked or fried: The stand around the corner from my apartment serves the tastiest knish that I have ever had. My grandmother's knishes are a beloved treat in our family.
More examplesFewer examplesYou can fill your knish with almost anything, but my favourite is potato with bacon and cheddar cheese.
